intro: Elatostema brevipedunculatum, commonly known as the small-stemmed elatostema, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related plants. The plant features small, heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy coating, and it produces tiny greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
